main event: A round object, described as the size of a large pea, was observed in San Juan, Puerto Rico on February 26, 1960, emitting brilliant yellow-orange lights and leaving a contrail.
interesting points: The sighting lasted less than one minute., The object left a contrail that persisted for at least 10 minutes., Four additional reports were made by friends and others in the general area., Ground observers from a nearby air force base did not see the object, possibly due to cloud cover., Initial analysis suggested it might have been a reentry of a ballistic missile or satellite.
sighted object: a round object with brilliant yellow-the-orange lights
witness description: the observer was Reginald P Briggs, age 44, a geologist working for the U.S. Department of Interior in Puerto Rico
